poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Been quite a trek: each stop
A woodcut in the mud
Or cursive in the sand
Or nothing at all
On roads and rocks
Criss-crossed my geodesic
A ragged web, pyrethrum-soaked
And me the bait mosquitoes get through
To. Both laughably low tech,
Me at least. These lines
So seldom caught.
